Name: 2-OCTANOL
Description: Octan-2-ol is an octanol carrying the hydroxy group at position 2. It has a role as a volatile oil component and a plant metabolite. It is an octanol and a secondary alcohol.

plant_concentrations.References: (1) Nishimura O; J agric Food Chem 43: 2941-5 (1995) (2) Burdock GA, ed; Fenaroli's Handbook of Flavor Ingredients. 5th ed., Boca Raton, FL: CRC Press p. 1420 (2004) (3) Wang C et al; Phytochemistry 58: 227-32 (2001)
plant_concentrations.Value: 2-Octanol was identified as a volatile component of fresh ginger root(1). 2-Octanol was identified in oil of Reunion geranium, a few species of mint and lavender; it is reported in apple, banana, kumquat peel oil, cranberry, asparagus, peas, thyme, hop oil, tea, oats, soybeans, coconut meat, Brazil nut, buckwheat, loquat and sweet corn(2). 2-Octanol was detected in the leaf of tomato plants(3).

plant_concentrations.References: (1) USDA; Dr. Duke's Phytochemical and Ethnobotanical Databases. Plants with a chosen chemical. 2-Octanol, Octanol. Washington, DC: US Dept Agric, Agric Res Service. Available from, as of Sept 21, 2015: https://www.ars-grin.gov/duke/
